intro.description: JasperReports supports a large number of built-in charts created using the popular open source library JFreeChart. Chart types include Pie, Bar, Stacked Bar, Line, Area, Bubble, Gantt, Thermometer and Meter. In this tutorial we will learn how to add a bar chart to a report.

item.title: Set the chart
item.description: Drag and Drop the chart element from the Palette into the Summary band, then wizard of the chart will appear.

item.title: Select the type of chart
item.description: From the first step of the wizard select the bar chart and hit Next.

item.title: Add the series and labels for the cities
item.description: In the fields Series and Label add the value $F{SHIPCITY}.

item.title: Select the correct dataset
item.description: In the field Dataset select the dataset created before.

item.title: Set the value
item.description: For the field Value use $F{C1}, to have the number of shipments for every city.

item.title: Complete the wizard
item.description: The category is not needed, so in the field Category insert an empty string with a double quote. Then hit the button Finish.

item.title: Change the size of the summary
item.description: Select the summary band and set its height to 500.

item.title: Resize the chart
item.description: Resize the chart to fill the summary band, you can right click on the chart , go under Size To Container and select Fit Both.
